intro: Hippaton hippomarathrum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has silvery, fuzzy leaves that help reduce water loss in its saline environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dunes or rocky shores. Hippaton hippomarathrum plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
